docs.lead_paragraph: Although the circumstances are unusual, the city is acting normally in providing a service to the needy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. appeals court on Friday denied Utah's bid to further block legal recognition of about 1,300 same-sex weddings performed after the state's gay marriage ban was briefly lifted by a federal judge in December.

headline.main: U.S. Appeals Court Sides With Gay Marriage Proponents in Utah
headline.print_headline: U.S. Appeals Court Sides With Gay Marriage Proponents in Utah

docs.snippet: A U.S. appeals court on Friday denied Utah's bid to further block legal recognition of about 1,300 same-sex weddings performed after the state's gay marriage ban was briefly lifted by a federal judge in December.

docs.lead_paragraph: New enrollments in Obamacare's Medicaid expansion and other healthcare programs for the poor have reached 6.7 million people since the launch of President Barack Obama's healthcare reforms last year, the administration said on Friday.

headline.main: U.S. Medicaid Enrollment Nears 7 Million Since Obamacare Rollout
headline.print_headline: U.S. Medicaid Enrollment Nears 7 Million Since Obamacare Rollout

headline.main: Blackstone to Buy a Wealth Management Business

docs.abstract: The insurer Friends Life Group, based on the Channel Island of Guernsey, agreed to sell its Luxembourg-based wealth management arm for about $610 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials will know by early August whether the state can move forward with its own retooled health exchange or join the federal marketplace.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Decision on Health Site Expected
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Decision on Health Site Expected

docs.abstract: Massachusetts officials announce they will know by early August whether the state can move forward with its own retooled health exchange or join the federal marketplace.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new law is off to a good start, with most of those who signed up reporting that they are pleased.

headline.main: Early Returns on Health Care Reform
headline.print_headline: Early Returns on Health Care Reform

docs.abstract: Editorial contends national survey published by Commonwealth Fund offers encouraging reviews from people across country who signed up for private plans or Medicaid during first enrollment period of Affordable Care Act; maintains reform effort is off to good start, particularly in states determined to take full advantage of the law.
docs.snippet: The new law is off to a good start, with most of those who signed up reporting that they are pleased.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Sadomonetarism,” the interests of the 0.01 percent and the politicization of economics.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column contends much of hysteria over Federal Reserve policies designed to stimulate the economy is fueled by richest 0.01 percent of society, as that section of the population is most harmed by low interest rates; warns that as a result, monetary policy has become as bound up in class and ideological conflict as tax policy.
docs.snippet: “Sadomonetarism,” the interests of the 0.01 percent and the politicization of economics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner said his lawsuit against the president would focus on changes to the health care law that should have been left to Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unemployment claims dropped by 11,000 as the labor market continued to improve.

headline.main: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall to Lowest Level Since Before Recession
headline.print_headline: Job Market Improvement Cuts Claims for Benefits

docs.abstract: Labor Dept reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits fell to one of its lowest levels since before the 2007-9 recession, sign of increasing health in labor market; says initial claims dropped by 11,000, to seasonally adjusted 304,000 for week ending July 5, 2014.
docs.snippet: Unemployment claims dropped by 11,000 as the labor market continued to improve.
